page.title: 03INSTOW PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The church serves the community of Instow. It is 800 years old with tombstones of that date in the churchyard. The oldest part of the church is the font dating from Norman times. The first recorded vicar was Clement De Langeford in 1260. The churchyard has a well preserved lychgate. One of the most interesting tombstones dates from 1160 and commemorates two children who died from smallpox. Today it is a lively church with an active congregation. It is currently undergoing renovations to its tower and roof. The present Vicar is John Spear who maintains regular links with the school.
